body_html: I think this would be a bit unsafe since Scalar could be any type (e.g. float), which means we'd have to defer a possible type error to runtime rather than compile type. Is x[y.toInt()] really a problem?
body_text: I think this would be a bit unsafe since Scalar could be any type (e.g. float), which means we'd have to defer a possible type error to runtime rather than compile type. Is x[y.toInt()] really a problem?
body: I think this would be a bit unsafe since `Scalar` could be any type (e.g. `float`), which means we'd have to defer a possible type error to runtime rather than compile type. Is `x[y.toInt()]` really a problem?
